answers.author: Kenneth Decker
answers.text:
A bonus by any other name....  The most simple example is a retention bonus where the city manager collects the amount if he/she completes the term of a contract.  Most annual peformance bonuses are tied to the city manager's evaluation... and the evaluation criteria are generally agreed upon by the manager and the governing body.  In my experience, these criteria vary widely from jurisdiction to jurisdiction.  Honestly, I think it's incumbent on the manager to find metrics and hammer out a deal with the elected.

author: Steven Crowell
text: I am interested in receiving some specific examples of additional compensation for City Managers (i.e. "bonus," although I do not like the term) tied directly to specific performance measures.  Any examples would be appreciated.
